has been satisfactorily made out & I 
believe universally admitted by all competent 
persons.
It is perhaps not requisite to attempt 
to explain all the appearances described 
by Mr Rainey & sufficient to say that 
most if not all of them maybe regarded 
As indicative of various stages or forms 
of degeneration either of the embryo 
Taenia itself at different ages or of the 
tissues in which it is lodged.
